intro: Thysanotus volubilis, commonly known as the climbing lily or starflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, fragrant blooms in shades of white, pink, and purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Thysanotus volubilis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
